title: Conflict Resolution: Violent and Nonviolent
description: Psychological, situational, political, and cultural determinants of violence and nonviolence in interpersonal, intergroup, and international conflict. Self-assessment of conflict resolution attitudes, competencies, and behaviors. Negotiation, mediation, and other approaches to conflict management. Educational and structural approaches to violence prevention. 4 lectures. Fulfills GE D5 except for Psychology and Child Development majors.
prerequisites: Junior standing; and completion of GE Area A, PSY 201 or PSY 202, and one course from D3
